image.altText: People crowd around a huge crater in a decimated urban area.

items.synopsis: A Gaza hospital director says more than 50 Palestinians are dead and 150 wounded after Israeli air strikes on the densely populated Jabalia refugee camp.

title.children: Israel says strikes on refugee camp killed senior Hamas leader, Palestinian officials say 50 people dead

image.altText: Girl in silhouette watches sunset from rocks

items.synopsis: El Niño is tipped to bring scorching temperatures to the east, but its impact is less clear in WA. However, there's another climate driver that will bring some serious summer heat.

title.children: How weather systems could work in tandem to deliver one of the hottest-ever summers in WA

image.altText: An older woman with long black hair and statement silver earrings poses with a gentle smile in a office

items.synopsis: "Where to now" is a universal question being asked in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities across the country in the wake of the failed Voice referendum. And there's another question that often runs alongside it: "What went wrong?"

title.children: 'I knew it was doomed': What are the lessons learnt for the Yes campaign?

image.altText: A woman stands with a young girl in front of a memorial plaque.

items.synopsis: Just over a year since his tragic death, Cassius Turvey's life has been memorialised with a plaque unveiled on his favourite day of the year.

title.children: Memorial plaque for late Indigenous teen Cassius Turvey unveiled in Perth park

image.altText: Robert Williams with his daughters

items.synopsis: In January 2020, Robert Williams was wrongly arrested — the victim of a faulty artificial intelligence (AI) facial recognition system. Even as he fought to clear his name, the system continued operating.

title.children: 'Computer got it wrong': Robert was locked up by AI for a crime he didn't commit

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage holds a gun to their chest.

items.synopsis: These elite agencies have one role: to ensure that from now on Israel is not unprepared and does not lose this new war with Hamas, writes John Lyons.

title.children: A former PM once dressed in drag to assassinate a Palestinian leader. His old unit is still key to Israel's plans

image.altText: A close shot of a woman in a green shirt

items.synopsis: The alliance between the Liberal and National parties in WA is in serious doubt following North West Central MP Merome Beard quitting the Nationals to join the Liberals.

title.children: WA Nationals MP Merome Beard defects to Liberal Party, throwing future of 'opposition alliance' into doubt

image.altText: Aerial view of large mining sand pile in a pit, surrounded by scrub.

items.synopsis: The rural community of Eneabba wants Iluka Resources to build worker accommodation for its workers in town, but the company says it will be led by what its staff wants.

title.children: Country community calls on lithium miner to house refinery's workers in town

image.altText: A young man wears a pink tie-dye shirt and silver necklace

items.synopsis: A man who deliberately lit a gas canister on a four-wheel-drive track, which exploded and killed a young father-to-be, will spend at least the next four years in jail.

title.children: Man jailed for setting alight gas canister on bush track that exploded with 'extraordinary force', killing father-to-be

image.altText: A two-storey red brick home.

items.synopsis: Property prices accelerated 0.9 per cent in October, but there are signs the rate of growth is slowing.

title.children: National home prices rise to be just half a per cent off last year's historic high

image.altText: Matildas players cheer reacting to a penalty shoot out in a large stadium

items.synopsis: The Matildas will face off against Chinese Taipei tonight in stage two of the Olympic qualifiers. A win or draw will guarantee them a spot in the final stage of qualification in February.

title.children: What time do the Matildas play tonight? Here's everything you need to know about their next Olympic qualifier

image.altText: An island with palm trees surrounded by turquoise water.

items.synopsis: Federal police shut down a series of websites responsible for distributing almost 1 million child exploitation images and videos through an internet domain assigned to the Cocos (Keeling) Islands.

title.children: Ten 'abhorrent' child abuse sites using tiny Australian island's domain blocked by authorities

image.altText: Headshot selfie of a young woman wearing glasses

items.synopsis: Cameron Pearson, who is believed to be the partner of 34-year-old Perth lawyer Alice McShera, appears in court after her body was found in an upmarket hotel room on Monday, as tributes flow for the family law specialist.

title.children: ‘Someone to aspire to’: Tributes flow for lawyer found dead at Crown Towers as alleged murderer faces court

image.altText: Vladimir Putin wins Russian vote

items.synopsis: An economic sanction is intended to peacefully protect the world's citizens. Too often, they have the opposite effect.

title.children: Economic sanctions are failing to slow down Russia. Research predicted this could happen

image.altText: A close-up view of a man wearing a black beanie and blue polo shirt against a red brick wall.

items.synopsis: A redress scheme for Victorian victims of historical abuse and neglect in institutional care has stalled since its announcement a year ago, and some eligible care leavers have died waiting for the scheme.

title.children: Former state wards abused in care feel 'invisible' as Victoria's redress promise stalls

image.altText: A tribute to a woman, with a colourful background and a poem inscribed behind.

items.synopsis: Those who knew her best have remembered Analyn " Logee" Osias as a mother, a beloved friend, a devoted member of her church, and a woman who drew people from all walks of life together.

title.children: Bendigo mum Analyn 'Logee' Osias remembered as 'beautiful soul' at community vigil

image.altText: Writer, blogger Yang Hengjun

items.synopsis: Australian writer Yang Hengjun has been detained in China for almost five years. Now his family fear there is a narrowing window of opportunity to secure his release.

title.children: Family of Australian writer Yang Hengjun plead for PM to raise case during Beijing visit

image.altText: Three Tasmania JackJumpers basketball team players in Indigenous design uniform.

items.synopsis: A row over the design of basketball jerseys has resulted in Tasmania's JackJumpers abandoning plans to wear a local artist's Aboriginal-themed work at this weekend's NBL Indigenous Round.

title.children: 'Dot' design stirs controversy as JackJumpers confirms they will not wear First Nations jersey

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A man looks very determined and holds the legal document above his head

items.synopsis: Decades of struggle in Western Australia's Goldfields has come to an end with the Federal Court formally recognising the native title rights and interests of the Nyalpa Pirniku claim group.

title.children: 'Today we belong': 30-year struggle for native title rights celebrated in remote WA

image.altText: Shanelle Dawson with parents

items.synopsis: After decades of deception, a protracted police investigation and a very public trial, Shanelle Dawson reclaims her story, sharing the betrayal of losing her mum at the hands of her own father.

title.children: Chris Dawson's misogyny 'major' red flag for daughter Shanelle as she processed mother's disappearance

image.altText: Jacob Hoysted, smiling and wearing a denim jacket, stands in a garden.

items.synopsis: Jacob Hoysted murdered Monica Stockdale at an aged care facility last year, but lawyers disagree about his reasons for doing so.

title.children: 'Thrill kill' or act of mercy? Motive in dispute after aged care worker admitted murdering elderly resident

image.altText: A man wearing a blue blazer, white shirt and blue tie and glasses walks along a busy street.

items.synopsis: A Perth court hears new details in the case of the former chief executive of Joondalup Health Campus after he pleaded guilty to charges relating to accessing and soliciting child abuse material online.

title.children: Former Perth hospital chief paid adults to share stories about underage sexual experiences, court hears

image.altText: This aerial photo shows first responders take position outside the post office.

items.synopsis: After an hours-long stand-off, Japanese police detain a man who they believe was also involved in an incident at the hospital that wounded two people.

title.children: Japanese police detain elderly man after post office hostage situation

image.altText: Palestinians conduct search and rescue works at the site of an Israeli strike on a house in Rafah.

items.synopsis: Israel says its forces have attacked Hamas gunmen inside the Islamists' vast tunnel network beneath Gaza, after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dismissed calls for a halt to fighting to ease the Palestinian enclave's humanitarian crisis.

title.children: Israel-Gaza war updates: Israel engages Hamas militants inside Gaza's tunnels, Netanyahu rejects ceasefire calls

image.altText: A group of soldiers in a vehicle

items.synopsis: For weeks, the objectives of Israel's ground assault in Gaza have remained obscured by a veil of secrecy. But as tanks push further and further into the coastal enclave, a plan is starting to take shape.

title.children: Israel's war strategy in Gaza is slowly emerging. It's unlike anything they've done there before

image.altText: Karen Lancaster, 71, has a concerned expression on her face.

items.synopsis: Virgin Australia is sitting on hundreds of millions of dollars in unused COVID-19 flight credits, with customers who booked flights for routes the airline no longer operates being refused refunds.

title.children: Karen is blind and wants to visit her family, but Virgin Australia won't refund her cancelled flights

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: The trial over the deadly White Island eruption has ended with the final defendant, Whakaari Management Limited, handed the court's verdict in Auckland.

title.children: Company held by White Island volcano owners found guilty as criminal proceedings conclude

image.altText: A man wearing a cap.

items.synopsis: One year since Clinton Lockyer disappeared near Roebourne, his mother has released an impassioned plea for information regarding his whereabouts.

title.children: 'The uncertainty has been excruciating': Mother of missing Pilbara man desperate for information

image.altText: A young girl gives the thumbs up while wearing a Parramatta Eels jersey.

items.synopsis: An inquest looking into mistakes by staff before the death of Rozalia Spadafora at Canberra Hospital hears there was confusion about which doctor was responsible for her bed.

title.children: 'I'm sorry, I did not': Doctor tells coronial inquest she didn't know she was responsible for overseeing 5yo's care

image.altText: The War of the Worlds

items.synopsis: Eighty-five years ago this week, families across the United States settled down around their radios for what they thought would be a regular evening — then Martians attacked.

title.children: 85 years ago, tensions were running high. Here's why one hour of radio sparked weeks of outrage
